description.content:
Last Updated July 2025

You can use Oracle REST APIs to view and manage data stored in Oracle Supply Chain Management Cloud.

Whether you're experienced with or new to REST, use this guide to find what you need, including:

  • A quick start that walks you through a simple request example.
  • Detailed descriptions for each REST API resource.

When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AllowDirectPurchWo; string; Value that uniquely identifies the AllowDirectPurchWo.
  • AllowResrvtnsWoFlag; boolean; Value that uniquely identifies the AllowResrvtnsWoFlag.
  • AutoAsscSerNumberWo; string; Value that uniquely identifies the AutoAsscSerNumberWo.
  • BusinessUnitId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the BusinessUnitId.
  • ContractMfgFlag; boolean; Contains one of the following values: true or false.
  • DefCompltnLocator; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the DefCompltnLocator.
  • DefCompltnSubinventory; string; Value that uniquely identifies the DefCompltnSubinventory.
  • DefLabelTmplt; string; Value that uniquely identifies the DefLabelTmplt.
  • DefMrbLocator; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the DefMrbLocator.
  • DefMrbSubinventory; string; Value that uniquely identifies the DefMrbSubinventory.
  • DefOvercompltnTol; number; Value that uniquely identifies the DefOvercompltnTol.
  • DefSupplyLocator; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the DefSupplyLocator.
  • DefSupplySubinventory; string; Value that uniquely identifies the DefSupplySubinventory.
  • DefTransactionMode; string; Value that uniquely identifies the DefTransactionMode.
  • DefTransactionQuantity; string; Value that uniquely identifies the DefTransactionQuantity.
  • DefUndercompltnTol; number; Value that uniquely identifies the DefUndercompltnTol.
  • DefWoTravelerTmplt; string; Value that uniquely identifies the DefWoTravelerTmplt.
  • DefaultInclPlanBulk; string; Value that uniquely identifies the DefaultInclPlanBulk.
  • DefaultInclPlanSupplier; string; Value that uniquely identifies the DefaultInclPlanSupplier.
  • DefaultLotBhvrCode; string; Value that uniquely identifies the DefaultLotBhvrCode.
  • EamEnabledFlag; boolean; Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true then the Organization is Maintenance Org.
  • EnableRobotics; string; Value that uniquely identifies the EnableRobotics.
  • ForecastHorizon; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the ForecastHorizon.
  • GenWoHorizon; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the GenWoHorizon.
  • HCMSchedulerEnabledFlag; boolean; Value that uniquely identifies the HCMSchedulerEnabledFlag.
  • IncCOMPYieldFlag; boolean; Value that uniquely identifies the IncCOMPYieldFlag.
  • InventoryEnabledFlag; boolean; Contains one of the following values: true or false.
  • InventoryFlag; boolean; Contains one of the following values: true or false.
  • MaximumSchedDuration; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the MaximumSchedDuration.
  • MfgCalendar; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the MfgCalendar.
  • OprnSequenceIncrement; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the OprnSequenceIncrement.
  • OrgId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the OrgId.
  • OrganizationCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the maintenance organization in which the plant parameter is executed. This attribute is not updatable.
  • OrganizationId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the maintenance organization in which the plant parameter is executed.
  • OrganizationName; string; Name that identifies the maintenance organization in which the plant parameter is executed. This attribute is not updatable.
  • PhntmOprnInherit; string; Value that uniquely identifies the PhntmOprnInherit.
  • ProjectReferenceEnabled; number; Value that uniquely identifies the ProjectReferenceEnabled.
  • PurchaseRequisitionCreateTime; string; Value that uniquely identifies the PurchaseRequisitionCreateTime.
  • QuantityChngBackflush; string; Value that uniquely identifies the QuantityChngBackflush.
  • RestrictLotForReturns; string; Value that uniquely identifies the RestrictLotForReturns.
  • StartingOprnSequence; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the StartingOprnSequence.
  • SupplierId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the SupplierId.
  • SupplierSiteId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the SupplierSiteId.
  • TrackCountryOfOriginFlag; boolean; Value that uniquely identifies the TrackCountryOfOriginFlag.
  • WoDocumentSequenceCatCode; string; Value that uniquely identifies the WoDocumentSequenceCatCode.
  • WoDocumentSequenceId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the WoDocumentSequenceId.
  • WoStartingNumber; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the WoStartingNumber.
  • WorkOrderPrefix; string; Value that uniquely identifies the WorkOrderPrefix.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Finds resources according to the primary key
    Finder Variables:
    • OrgId; integer; Finds resources according to the primary key
    • OrganizationId; integer; Finds resources according to the primary key
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Finds resources according to the primary key
    Finder Variables:
    • OrgId; integer; Finds resources according to the primary key
    • OrganizationId; integer; Finds resources according to the primary key
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key--- OrganizationId and OrgId ---for the Maintenance Plant Parameters resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Maintenance Plant Parameters. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Maintenance Plant Parameters collection resource with a filter on the primary key values in order to navigate to a specific instance of Maintenance Plant Parameters.

For example: maintenancePlantParameters?q=OrganizationId=<value1>;OrgId=<value2>
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".
